verses.kjv: The words of Nehemiah the son of Hachaliah. And it came to pass in the month Chisleu, in the twentieth year, as I was in Shushan the palace,
verses.ct: This is the account of Nehemiah son of Hachaliah. During the month of Chisleu, in the 20th year, while I was at the fortress in Shushan,

verses.kjv: That Hanani, one of my brethren, came, he and certain men of Judah; and I asked them concerning the Jews that had escaped, which were left of the captivity, and concerning Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Hanani, one of my brothers, arrived along with some men from Judah. I questioned them about the Jewish survivors who had made it through the exile, and about the condition of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And they said unto me, The remnant that are left of the captivity there in the province are in great affliction and reproach: the wall of Jerusalem also is broken down, and the gates thereof are burned with fire.
verses.ct: They told me, 'The survivors back in the province who made it through the exile are suffering terribly and are treated with contempt. Jerusalem's wall is in ruins, and its gates have been destroyed by fire.'

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when I heard these words, that I sat down and wept, and mourned certain days, and fasted, and prayed before the God of heaven,
verses.ct: When I heard this news, I sat down and cried. I grieved for days, going without food and praying to the God of heaven.

verses.kjv: And said, I beseech thee, O LORD God of heaven, the great and terrible God, that keepeth covenant and mercy for them that love him and observe his commandments:
verses.ct: I said, 'Please, LORD God of heaven, you are the great and awesome God who keeps his covenant and shows mercy to those who love him and follow his commandments.

verses.kjv: Let thine ear now be attentive, and thine eyes open, that thou mayest hear the prayer of thy servant, which I pray before thee now, day and night, for the children of Israel thy servants, and confess the sins of the children of Israel, which we have sinned against thee: both I and my father’s house have sinned.
verses.ct: Let your ears be attentive and your eyes open to hear the prayer of your servant, which I am praying in your presence right now, day and night, on behalf of the people of Israel, your servants. I am confessing the sins that we, the people of Israel, have committed against you. Both I and my father's family have sinned.

verses.kjv: We have dealt very corruptly against thee, and have not kept the commandments, nor the statutes, nor the judgments, which thou commandedst thy servant Moses.
verses.ct: We have acted with terrible corruption toward you. We have not followed the commandments, the rules, or the laws that you gave your servant Moses.

verses.kjv: Remember, I beseech thee, the word that thou commandedst thy servant Moses, saying, If ye transgress, I will scatter you abroad among the nations:
verses.ct: Please remember what you told your servant Moses when you said: If you are unfaithful, I will scatter you among the nations.

verses.kjv: But if ye turn unto me, and keep my commandments, and do them; though there were of you cast out unto the uttermost part of the heaven, yet will I gather them from thence, and will bring them unto the place that I have chosen to set my name there.
verses.ct: But if you return to me and obey my commandments and carry them out, then even if your exiles are at the farthest edge of the heavens, I will gather them from there and bring them back to the place I have chosen as the home for my name.

verses.kjv: Now these are thy servants and thy people, whom thou hast redeemed by thy great power, and by thy strong hand.
verses.ct: These are your servants and your people, whom you rescued through your tremendous power and your mighty hand.

verses.kjv: O LORD, I beseech thee, let now thine ear be attentive to the prayer of thy servant, and to the prayer of thy servants, who desire to fear thy name: and prosper, I pray thee, thy servant this day, and grant him mercy in the sight of this man. For I was the king’s cupbearer.
verses.ct: LORD, please let your ear be attentive to the prayer of your servant and to the prayers of your servants who long to be wholeheartedly dedicated to your name. Give your servant success today, and cause this man to show me mercy.' I said this because I served as the king's cupbearer.
